--- Kenneth Stanley <kstanley@...> wrote:
> Mitchell, didn't you do some work on RARS?  Can you
> say a little able
> what your role was?  We are thinking of using RARs
> now for one of our
> projects. 

Yes, I am the founder and inventor of RARS!  I wrote
all of the first several versions of the software. 
After the first year I let other people take it over.
Perhaps you have come across Remi Coulom's doctoral
dissertation?  A part of that consists of discussing
an ANN based robot driver for the RARS races.

At that time I knew a little C++ and used that for
RARS.  Mostly I wrote it the same as C, but I did
define at least one class, maybe two.  But I didn't
continue with C++ after that and eventually forgot it
almost completely.

=====
Mitchell Timin
http://annevolve.sourceforge.net
